medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain for three days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began three days ago after eating cantaloupe and has been sharp and constant, localized to the right lower quadrant. The current pain is less severe compared to previous ulcerative colitis flares. The patient has had flatus and bowel movements, which were absent during flares. Nausea has been present for about a week, but no vomiting or diarrhea. The patient also reports generalized weakness and has not felt herself over the last three days. Ibuprofen taken yesterday provided some relief.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative Colitis (stable), Hypertension, Diabetes Mellitus, Hyperlipidemia, Hysterectomy (years ago), Left inguinal hernia repair (years ago)
